result.execSummary:
The defendant Angus W Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Upon revocation, defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one year.

miscConds.notes:
TERMS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Cooperate with the Department. Complete cognitive intervention program. Complete parenting program
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Court ordered defendant provide DNA sample and pay surcharge on count 1 only over period of probation; balance to be converted to civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.

supervisions.notes: DNA surcharge on count 2 waived as the court finds an inability to pay and one surcharge is sufficient. Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation (in CT 1); balance to be converted to civil judgment.
Good time to apply. Huber for work, treatment or any testing to avail himself for the apprenticeship or school.  Defendant taken into custody forthwith.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Heard in br 34 for br 26
Defendant Angus W Wright in court with attorney Robin Shellow.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counts 1 and 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
**********
 Statements made as to sentencing.
Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS, with credit for 4 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 years.  This sentence is stayed and defendant placed on PROBATION for a period of 4 years.  Upon revocation, the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one year.
Terms of probation and extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Complete cognitive intervention program
-Complete parenting program
-Seek and maintain full time employment

Count 2:
The court sentenced defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction-good time to apply, with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber for work, treatment or any testing to avail himself for the apprenticeship or school.  Defendant taken into custody forthwith.

The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample and pay surcharge on count 1 only over period of probation; balance to be converted to civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  Surcharge on count 2 waived as the court finds an inability to pay and one surcharge is sufficient.
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid over period of probation; balance to be converted to civil judgment.  Upon revocation through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Scheduling conference scheduled for 05-09-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angus W Wright in court with Trisha Fritz, student intern under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Paul Hauer for Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Angus W Wright in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Angus W Wright in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
